column4: could someone help me with a dual boot/data partition question please?
I have too many primary partitions (and i don't really know what i'm doing)
i have windows 7 (with system reserve), ubuntu 10.10 with swap partition
so i can't create the data partition (can't have more than 4 primary partitions)
which setting should i pick at setup? just "extended"?
sorry, just to be sure of the order
do i create the ntfs data partition before doing the linux install?
you shaoud install windows before linux, otherwise you may need to reinstall grub
can i just install ubuntu as logical off the live cd?
main partition should be phisical (it do contains bootloader)
